== Using Ubuntu on an IBM/Lenovo ThinkPad X41, model number 2527 ==

=== Table of Contents ===

See LaptopTestingTeam and <nowiki>[[DanielTChen]]</nowiki>; please contact me via email for debugging assistance.

=== Specifications ===

* Intel(R) Pentium(R) M processor 1.50GHz
* 512MB RAM (default, currently expanded to 1.5GB RAM)
* 40GB Hard Disk
* IRQ 11	Intel(R) 82801FB/FBM SMBus Controller - 266A
* IRQ 11       Ricoh(R) Secure digital card reader
* IRQ 12	IBM Think''''''Pad Ultra''''''Nav Pointing Device
* IRQ 13	Numeric data processor
* IRQ 14	Primary IDE Channel
* IRQ 15	Secondary IDE Channel
* IRQ 16	Mobile Intel(R) 915GM/GMS,910GML Express Chipset Family
* IRQ 16	Intel(R) 82801FB/FBM USB Universal Host Controller - 2658
* IRQ 16	Ricoh(R) RL5c476 II Card''''''Bus Controller
* IRQ 17	Intel(R) 82801FB/FBM USB Universal Host Controller - 2659
* IRQ 18	Intel(R) 82801FB/FBM USB Universal Host Controller - 265A
* IRQ 19	Intel(R) 82801FB/FBM USB Universal Host Controller - 265B
* IRQ 19	Intel(R) 82801FB/FBM USB2 Enhanced Host Controller - 265C
* IRQ 20	Intel(R) 82801FB/FBM PCI Express Root Port - 2660
* IRQ 21	Intel(R) PRO/Wireless 2915ABG Network Connection
* IRQ 22	Intel(R) 82801FB/FBM PCI Express Root Port - 2664
* IRQ 22	Intel(R) ICH6 integrated audio with AD1981B AC'97 codec
* IRQ 23	Intel(R) AC'97 Modem Controller
* Toys:
** Fingerprint reader
** Hard drive shock protection
** Bluetooth
** Secure digital card reader

=== Functionality issues present in Ubuntu releases ===

This section describes problems I have experienced while running Ubuntu Hoary, Breezy, Dapper, Edgy, Feisty and/or Gutsy on this laptop. For more information, please see the individual reports.
* Fingerprint reader not working by default (out of the box)
* Hard drive shock protection not providing feedback/not working by default (out of the box)
* If laptop was connected to the X4 Ultrabase dock at boot time, then suspend-to-ram hangs the machine; see Launchpad bug <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/malone/bugs/30410|#30410]]</nowiki>  -- MichaelShulman
* In Feisty, POST_VIDEO=false is required in /etc/default/acpi-support for functional resume from suspend-to-ram

=== Startup Times ===

* Bootup to Windows XP post-SP2 (GRUB to post-login usable system) - 70 seconds
* Bootup to Ubuntu Edgy (GRUB to post-login usable system) - 30 seconds
* Suspend-to-ram (Edgy) - 5 seconds
* Resume from suspend-to-ram (Edgy) - 5 seconds
* Suspend-to-disk/Hibernate (Edgy) - 20 seconds
* Resume from suspend-to-disk/hibernate (Edgy, GRUB to post-login functional system) - 20 seconds
* Suspend-to-ram (Windows XP post-SP2) - 5 seconds
* Resume from suspend-to-ram (Windows XP post-SP2) - 5 seconds
* Suspend-to-disk/Hibernate (Windows XP post-SP2) - 10 seconds
* Resume from suspend-to-disk/hibernate (Windows XP post-SP2) - 10 seconds

=== Notes ===
Make sure the latest BIOS is being used: Version: 74ET64WW (2.09 ), Release Date: 01/23/2007 [from ''sudo dmidecode'']

Likewise, make sure the latest Embedded Controller is being used: Version: 74HT27WW (1.02), Release Date: 06/05/2006 [also from ''sudo dmidecode'']
